history.content:
My understanding is that Algorithms is pretty much the same thing everywhere and that thus it shouldn't make a difference how you learn it. But then, 170 seems to be a part of the unofficial rite of passage for CS majors at Berkeley and a compulsory class in most other schools (and kind of a staple for us).

I think that internships care more about your actual projects and how you have used what you've learned in class. You can always include the knowledge in your CV (if you have it ofc) and I don't think they'll care a lot if it is something you self-studied. I myself would still recommend you to take the course because it will haze into a very deep understanding of the material that you might not get out of self-studying it unless you are very determined and disciplined. Again, your motivation for taking this class should be more about "how I can be a better computer scientist and what knowledge and skillset I can get from this class" rather than "is this getting me an internship or not?". Everything becomes more worthwhile when you are actually motivated to learn

children.subject: I think you should still take the class either way. I don't know why you want to skip it during the semester but you can self study in the summer and use the class in fall to measure your understanding of the material and to alleviate your concern I assume it would take much less time and be slightly easier. I can't really think of a reason to skip this class (since it seems to me that you understand its value and is interested) unless you have already dealt with related materials for years.

history.content:
I've been trying to decide whether to take CS 170 this fall, or self-study it this summer. But I was wondering if it would be a better idea to take the actual class. Will it look better for internships or on your transcript to have taken the class (rather than self-studied)?

Any advice is much appreciated.
history.subject: Better to take CS170 or can I just self study?
